name: UISplitViewController.DisplayMode
desc: Constants that describe the possible arrangements for a split view interface.

items.name: case automatic
items.desc: The split view controller automatically decides the most appropriate display mode based on the device and the current app size.

items.name: case secondaryOnly
items.desc: Only the secondary view controller is shown onscreen.

items.name: case oneBesideSecondary
items.desc: One sidebar appears side-by-side with the secondary view controller.

items.name: case oneOverSecondary
items.desc: One sidebar is layered on top of the secondary view controller, leaving the secondary view controller partially visible.

items.name: case twoBesideSecondary
items.desc: Two sidebars appear side-by-side with the secondary view controller.

items.name: case twoOverSecondary
items.desc: Two sidebars are layered on top of the secondary view controller, leaving the secondary view controller partially visible.

items.name: case twoDisplaceSecondary
items.desc: Two sidebars displace the secondary view controller instead of overlapping it, moving it partially offscreen.
